generator_template.title: Newism Default Blog
generator_template.description: This is the default schema Newism uses for it's sites.

channel_field.field_instructions:
Enter the testimonial.
To create an excerpt, place your mouse curse where you wish to include a 'Read More' link and then click the 'Page Break' icon at the top of the editor.
Enter the name of the testifier.
Enter the the testifiers role in their company
Enter the role of this people
Upload an thumbnail for the gallery. This will appear on the Galleries index page.

{!-- Pre-fetch the shiz out of it. https://github.com/paulirish/html5-boilerplate/wiki/DNS-Prefetching https://gist.github.com/581868 --} {!-- Always force latest IE rendering engine (even in intranet) & Chrome Frame Remove this if you use the .htaccess --} {!-- Entry / Site Meta Using a tag pair overrides the extension settings. --} {exp:nsm_better_meta:template} {title} {if canonical_url} {/if} {!-- Google Meta --} {/exp:nsm_better_meta:template} {!-- Suppress IE6's pop-up-on-mouseover toolbar for images, that can interfere with certain designs. --} {!-- IE9 Pinned Site Settings! Documentation: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-ca/library/gg131029(VS.85).aspx See the documentation for JavaScript APIs, as well. --} {!-- Pinned site name, as Windows sees it - this will be the page title by default, unless you include this rule. --} {!-- Pinned shortcuts also get a tooltip - this is it. --} {!-- If the site should go to a specific URL when it is pinned (such as the homepage), enter it here. One idea is to send it to a special URL so you can track # of pinned users, like so: http://www.example.com/index.html?pinned=true --} {!-- IE9 will automatically use the overall color of your site's favicon to shade its browser buttons. UNLESS you give it another color here. Only use named colors ("red") or hex colors ("#f00"). --} {!-- If the site should open at a certain window size once pinned, you can specify the dimensions here. It only supports static pixel dimensions. 800x600 minimum. --} {!-- Define Jump List tasks that will appear when the pinned site's icon gets a right-click. Each "task" goes to the specified URL, and gets its own mini icon (essentially a favicon, a 16x16 .ICO). --} {!-- Site msg sits outside of the #header. It can be used for temporary messages or... site alerts. --}

{exp:nsm_better_meta:entries_xml channel="live_chat" dyanmic="no" use_page_url="yes" }

{!-- Search index ============ Displays search form and results. Requirements: ------------- Structure page with hardcoded entry_id in preload:replace below. Assign search/index as the page template in Structure. This is because the URL will change once the search has been submitted and we need to force the entry --} {preload_replace:this_page_channel="pages"} {preload_replace:this_page_id="18"} {exp:channel:entries channel="{this_page_channel}" entry_id="{this_page_id}" dynamic="no" limit="1" status="not closed|pending" {!-- Pulled from the config bootstrap as global variables --} {!-- global:param_disable_default --} {!-- global:param_cache_param --} } {embed="_partials/.header" entry_id="{entry_id}" template="index" template_group="search" }
{!--
  • Search /
{embed="_partials/_social-network" entry_id="{entry_id}" url_path="{site_url}{comment_url_title_auto_path}" }
--}

{if page_alternate_title}{page_alternate_title}{if:else}{title}{/if}

{page_content:excerpt}
{!-- Search Form --} {embed="search/_form-search" form_return="{path=search}" content="{page_content}{page_content_body}{/page_content}" }
{!-- Search Results --} {embed="search/_search-results"}
{embed="_partials/.footer"} {/exp:channel:entries}

{!-- Search form (embed) - {embed="search/_form-search"} =================== Filter products by keyword, category, status etc. @param string form_title The form title. @param string form_return The submission redirect page @param string form_prefix Applied to fields so they have a unique id. --} {preload_replace:form_slug="form-search"}
{if embed:form_title}{embed:form_title}{/if} {exp:low_search:form query="{segment_2}"}
{if error_message != ''}

{error_message}

{/if}
In {!-- 'Collections' are used to contain the search indexing results. We loop over the collections using the collections tag pair and build the select menu. the collection_is_active tag variable gives us a basic form memory --}
Show results per page
{/exp:low_search:form}

{!-- Simple search form (embed) - {embed='search/_form-search-simple'} ========================== Filter entries by keyword. @param string collections The desired collections to search in. @see http://gotolow.com/addons/low-search/docs/tags @param string form_return The submission redirect page @param string form_prefix Applied to fields so they have a unique id. --} {preload_replace:form_slug="form-search-simple"}
{exp:low_search:form collection="{embed:collection}" form_id="{embed:form_prefix}{form_slug}" search_mode="all" result_page="{embed:form_return}" }
{/exp:low_search:form}

{!-- Form Create (embed) - embed="contact/_form-create" ================================ * Usually embedded into the contact.index.html template. * Using PHP the contact name is pulled from segment 2 and assigned to $selected_name * A query is made to the database and 2 tables ( people_position and people_email) are created from columns in 'exp_channel_titles' and 'exp_channel_data'. * Looping through the table, a list of recipients is assigned to $people_params[], and a select options assigned to $people_select[]. * You will have to confirm you are referencing the correct channel_id, and 'exp_channel_data' fields. * The $people_params[] are imploded as freeform parameters, whereas the $people_select[] are imploded as select options in the contact form. * A query string on ?response=200 is assigned to the form return parameter. As conditional looks for this response and if found, will output the value of the low variable '{form_contact_create_success_msg}' @param string form_title: The form title. NOTE: 1. PHP will need to be turned on & selected as 'input' for this template in 'Template Manager'. 2. Ensure 'Low Variables' is installed in 'Add-on Administration' > 'Modules', as this is used to store the success message. --} uri->segment(2); $EE->db->select('t.title, t.url_title, d.field_id_21 as people_position, d.field_id_24 as people_email'); $EE->db->from('channel_titles as t'); $EE->db->join('channel_data as d', 'd.entry_id = t.entry_id', 'left'); $EE->db->where('t.channel_id', 7); // channel 7 is people $EE->db->order_by('t.entry_id', 'asc'); $get_people = $EE->db->get(); $count = 1; foreach ($get_people->result_array() as $row) { $people_params[] = 'recipient' . $count . '="' . $row['title'] . '|' . $row['people_email'].'"'; $people_select[] = ''; $count += 1; } ?> {preload_replace:form_slug="form-contact-create"}
{if embed:get:response == 200}
{form_contact_create_success_msg} {!-- Thank you for contacting us. Your message has been sent to the appropriate recipient, who will respond to your enquiry you as soon as possible. --}
{/if} {exp:freeform:form required="name|email|phone|message" collection="Contact" form:id="form-contact" _notify="chris.buttery@newism.com.au" template="contact_admin" reply_to="yes" return="/contact/?response=200" recipients="yes" recipient_template="contact_recipient" } {if embed:form_title}

{embed:form_title}

{/if}
{/exp:freeform:form}

{!-- Archive Date (template) - events/.archive-date ================================ * Outputs and index of blog posts grouped by the entries date (YEAR, MONTH). --} {preload_replace:this_index_channel="events"} {embed="_partials/.header" entry_id="{entry_id}" template="date-archive" template-group="events" title="Events Date Archive" }

Date archive

{!-- Results are to be grouped by the entries date - entry_date format='%Y, %M' Ensure the param "parse" is set to "inward", so EE will parse plugins from the outside > in, otherwise the gravatar plugin will not interpret the {email} / {screen_name} tags. --}
{exp:nsm_channels:group_entries_by channel="{this_index_channel}" enable="entries" group_by="entry_date format='%Y, %M'" parse="inward" status="not closed" }
